usefulItems: fine mesh sieve, bowl, serving bowl
title: Penne with mussels

ingredients.content: 4 - 5 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
250 g water, plus extra as needed
1000 g fresh mussels, shells scrubbed and debearded
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for serving
1 fresh red chilli, small, deseeded if preferred (optional)
120 g cherry tomatoes, cut into halves
350 g penne pasta or similar short dried pasta

preparations.content: Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place water into mixing bowl. Place mussels into Varoma dish, place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>15 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma and check mussels have all opened. If not, remove open mussels and transfer into a bowl, place Varoma back into position and steam for a further <b>5-10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma, discard any mussels that remain closed, transfer open mussels into bowl and set aside. Strain the cooking liquid through a fine mesh sieve into another bowl and set aside.
Place oil, eschalots, garlic cloves and chilli (optional) into mixing bowl and chop <b>7 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add wine (optional) and cherry tomatoes and cook <b>2 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add tomato paste and reserved cooking liquid, adding water to reach 700 g, then bring to a boil <b>7 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.

Add salt and penne and cook for <b>time indicated on packet/100°C//speed <b> or until al dente. Meanwhile, remove mussels from opened shells, reserving some mussels in their shells to garnish and set aside.

Transfer pasta into a serving bowl, add reserved steamed mussels, stir to combine using spatula and drizzle with extra oil. Garnish with reserved chopped parsley and reserved mussels in their shells before serving.
